details.description: Fun is as important as academics. Compete against each other to find the ultimate gamer

events.name: FANDOM
events.description: Fandom's here with the most fun quizzes on your favourite TV shows and memes
events.long_description:
This quiz is about testing your knowledge on your favorite shows. FANDOM gives you a chance to attempt quizzes for the following shows:
A. Suits
B. The Office
C. Modern Family/ Harry Potter
The quiz is designed to test the participant's knowledge about the show attempted for, the characters, the flow and thus an opportunity to prove that the participant is a true fan of the series.
rules: You can attempt FANDOM quiz of one show ONLY ONCE.
If a team is caught cheating or playing by unfair means then the team will be disqualified.
Participants should reach the venue on time and must attend the quiz in the given slot only.
The decision of the respective Quiz Head will be final and will not be subject to any change.
Replacement of any participant is strictly not allowed.

Is on-spot participation allowed?

No. On-spot participation is not allowed.
Any college (UG)* student. You may be asked to present a valid ID card and the registration receipt.

events.name: Flash
events.description: Frame your view through the lens, then capture the perfect shot with a click.
events.long_description: This Event tries to get bring out the inner shutterbugs in us, capturing unique moments out of the ordinary, and invites photographers and videographers of all skill levels to participate in this theme-based contest. Categories are based on how you wish to tell your story visually and there are no restrictions on the number of categories you wish to participate in!
rules: Post processing of pictures is allowed.
Any kind of Equipment WILL NOT BE PROVIDED.
Participants can take part in either or both the events.
Unprocessed files must also be submitted along with the gear (mobile model/camera model + lens + Exif's) used must be mentioned.
The event head/coordinators have the right to deny the participant from participating in the event if participants break above mentioned rules.

structure.name: PHOTOGRAPHY
structure.description: A theme will be provided few days prior to the event day. Participants can   capture pictures according to what they interpret of said theme and can send them in a set of 3-5 images which will be judged on the basis of composition, post processing, ability to communicate the theme of the contest and overall aesthetics.

structure.name: VIDEOGRAPHY
structure.description:
1. Participants are supposed to make a video of duration of not more than 90 seconds which can showcase a visual story by the videographer or just an overall aesthetic from their point of view.
2. The use of background music apart from explicit music can be used.
3. The video can be in both horizontal and vertical formats.
4. Time-lapses, hyper-lapses, compilation is allowed.
5. The use of any kind of relevant video editing software is allowed.

structure.name: Elimination Criteria
structure.description:
1. Firstly, participants that fail to adhere to any of the rules of the contest will be disqualified.
2. The participants who fail to meet the deadline for submissions will also not be considered.
3. The photographs or videos should adhere to the guidelines provided with regards to the theme and the type of photographs and videos that are to be submitted. Failure to meet this criterion will lead to disqualification.
4. Any manner of misconduct or misbehaviour on the participants' end will not be tolerated.

details.description: Showcase and implement your knowledge about the laws and concepts of Physics

events.name: TAKE OFF
events.description: What is victory? It is touching the sky by manipulating the laws of aerodynamics. Defy the laws of gravity in this rocket competition.
events.long_description: Take-off is an event that gives you an opportunity to showcase and implement your knowledge about the laws and concepts of physics that govern the motion of a rocket in the air, its take-off, its trajectory, etc.

structure.description: Take-off consists of the participants using a pressure launcher to launch a water bottle rocket into the air. Participants have to construct their own water bottle rocket of a design of their choice. The event comprises three rounds which will be as follows-

structure.name: Round 1:
structure.description: The ground will be divided into six concentric zones from the launcher for this round. Further, the ground will be divided into 3 sectors, with each sector containing the mentioned 6 scoring zones. From the launching point, the participant will have to use the launcher to launch the water bottle rocket. The participants will have to choose one of the three sectors towards which they will be launching their rocket. The participant will be given points according to the area in which the rocket lands. If the rocket does not land in the sector chosen by the participant, no points will be awarded. The area and the points that the area holds will be visible during the event. This round will give 3 attempts to each team. The total score of the 3 attempts will be considered.

structure.name: Round 2:
structure.description: For this round, a target will be declared. Points will be awarded based on the distance between the rocket and the target. The point at which the rocket touches the ground for the first time will be considered, and subsequent bounces/sliding will not be considered.

structure.name: Round 3:
structure.description: In this round, the participants will have to attach a deployable parachute to the rocket using materials and design of their choice. Points will be awarded based on the time for which the rocket stays in the air after parachute deployment.

rules: Participants will be required to bring their college ID cards.
Participants will have to bring their own rockets made of plastic bottles and water. The launcher and pump will be provided by the organizing team of the event.
Only the launcher provided by the organizing team must be used. Use of other launchers or hand-based launchers is not permitted.
In Round 1, if the rocket falls on the boundary of two zones, then the points of the zone with higher points will be counted.
Points will be counted only for the time of flight before the rocket touches the ground for the first time.
In Round 3, participants will be disqualified in case the parachute doesn't open.
The pump pressure can only be applied in the given range as specified by the organizing team.

events.name: CONTRAPTION
events.description: A trial of your ability to manipulate energies as you transform one mechanical motion into another.
events.long_description: Conservation of energy and mass are two rules which govern the universe. This event is designed towards converting energy from one form to another and driving a series of events that will ultimately carry out the given task. The more complicated the contraption and the more forms of energy used, the higher the points earned.

structure.name: Round 1:
structure.description: The first round consists of abstract submission (soft copy) for which the problem statement will be released to all

structure.name: Round 2:
structure.description: Depending on the abstract, the top 6 teams will be short-listed for Round 2 which will be the qualification round. All the top 6 teams are expected to get 4 copies of the printed abstract for the event, clearly mentioning steps and chart, which shows all Energy conversions

structure.name: Elimination Criteria
structure.description:
Qualification for Round 2 is on the basis of:
1. Closeness/alignment with this year's theme.
2. Maximum conservation of energy.
3. Number of energy conversions - (more the conversions, better it is!).
4. Use of sustainable materials.

rules: The minimum and maximum time for contraption are 2 minutes and 6 minutes respectively. After 6 minutes, 30 Points per minute will be deducted per minute from the total score.

The contraption setup is to be developed in an area with dimensions 15ft X 20ft, and the height must not cross 5ft; (you may have a smaller setup not less than 5ft by 5ft) the setup should fit in an imaginary box of the above-mentioned dimensions.

Since the event will be held in the badminton court (VENUE) of the college, participants are requested to prevent spillage of any kind of fluid and should take precautionary measures in case of any such step involved.
No harmful explosives that may cause harm to the surroundings are to be included in the making of the contraption.

Two hand touches are allowed without deduction of points. Before the 3rd hand touch, the team would be given choice to go for 3rd hand touch or to go for the second trial. For 3rd, 4th and 5th hand touch, 30, 60, and 120 points will be deducted respectively from the total score.

If the team decides to go for the second attempt, 50 points will be deducted initially, and 2 hand touches will be allowed further with a deduction of 50 and 80 points, respectively. The team will be disqualified if they exceed the permissible number of hand touches (5 for attempt 1; and 2 for attempt 2) in the respective trial.
Sufficient set-up time will be given and 1 hour will be given for each team for first attempt and second attempt of the model respectively. Only 2   attempts are allowed.
No alteration (without prior notice) in any step will be allowed during the trial of the contraption.
Students should carry proof of identity issued by their institution.
The same person cannot be a member of more than one team. All teams involving a common person as a participant will be disqualified.
Participants are required to report at (TIME - to be DECIDED).
Participants should take due safety measures in their models.
Rules are subject to change without prior intimation. Participants are requested to check the MindSpark'23 website (www.mind-spark.org) regularly for updates.
All decisions of Judges, Event Heads, and Organizers will be final and binding to all participants. No arguments shall be entertained.
Bring special tools of your own if you think they are important for the building of your Contraption.
Extension boards for any required power supply will be provided by the organising committee.
Minimum number of steps is 4.

structure.name: Round 1:

structure.name: Round 2:
structure.description: Surprise Round for the winning teams from Round 1 who would compete against each other.

structure.name: Elimination Criteria
structure.description: Team who scores minimum 75% will be eligible for Round 2.

rules: Quiz master's decision will be final and binding to all.
Use of any form of electronic media is strictly prohibited. Any team found in violation will be disqualified on spot.

events.name: FOX HUNT
events.description: A game of hunt devoid of  trail of blood but makes you chase nonetheless.
events.long_description: The objective of this contest is to locate a hidden radio transmitter using radio direction-finding techniques. Participants should build the antenna and use equipment to track down the source of a transmitted signal that serves as the 'fox'. The hidden transmitter, or 'fox,' emits radio signals intermittently or continuously on a specific frequency or set of frequencies, and the participants must use their skills and equipment to determine the direction from which the signal is coming.
rules: Participants will be required to bring their college ID cards.
The first round of the contest will be an online MCQ quiz based on wireless communication and general knowledge related to the communication domain.
If a team is caught cheating or playing by unfair means, then the team will be disqualified.
Top 5 teams from Round 1 will be qualified for the Final on-Campus round.
The decision of the respective Quiz Head will be final and will not be subject to any change.
In Round 1, the teams will be judged based on accuracy and time of response.
Replacement of any participant is strictly not allowed.
If the no. of participating teams falls below 5, Round 2 will be conducted directly.

q: I am participating in another event in MindSpark. Can I still register for this event?
